body: Please post the code of how you're adding the plugin.

Can you check after moving the loadConfig() call above the foreach loop?

https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/94ab7ac1b1e82a48bfec6c01b8ce603b01cb76a0/src/Core/PluginCollection.php#L75-L79
ðŸ¤” no, this is not fixing it for me

Wouldn't that already be called in this stack:
```
#0 ..\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Core\PluginCollection.php(243): Cake\Core\PluginCollection->findPath('AuditStash')
#1 ..\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Http\BaseApplication.php(117): Cake\Core\PluginCollection->create('AuditStash', Array)
#2 ..\src\Application.php(78): Cake\Http\BaseApplication->addPlugin('AuditStash')
```

It sounds like the plugins config is changed between PluginCollection construction and bootstrap.
That's one of the downsides to writing code with 0 comments. :(
so the testcase is not properbly testing this, it should have failed, shouldn't it?

issue.title: Ensure plugin path config is loaded for each PluginCollection::findPath() call.

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
This is necessary primarily for testing because the Configure::clear() call
in TestCase::tearDown() wipes out all configuration including plugin paths config.

Reverts #14860. Closes #14889.

The best way to propose a feature is to open an issue first and discuss your ideas there before implementing them.

Always follow the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) when submitting a pull request. In particular, make sure existing tests still pass, and add tests for all new behavior. When fixing a bug, you may want to add a test to verify the fix.

-->

issue.title: UseMuffin & Flash Plugins Broken by 4.1.2

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
This is a (multiple allowed):

* [x] bug
* [ ] enhancement
* [ ] feature-discussion (RFC)

* CakePHP Version: 4.1.2
* Platform and Target: MacOS 11, Postgresql 11.

### What you did
On updating from 4.1.1 to 4.1.2, a number of plugins which were previously loading have become unusable.
The repo is: https://github.com/LBDistrictScouts/DistrictLeaders

### What happened
The plugins from UseMuffin (Muffin/Trash & Muffin/Footprint) as well as Flash.Flash became unloadable. I have resolved Flash.Flash, by resolving references to it back to cake core flash.

### What you expected to happen
I need a way to update without breaking my plugins. Is there an alias or something I can use? It appears to be the slash in the plugin name that is breaking the tests, but I can't locate the file or line in the 4.1.1 --> 4.1.2 diff that is causing it.
